title: Ticket #6800: Fix job priority sorting to have a well-defined ordering of jobs
description:
When the schedd sorts a user's jobs based on their priority, it actually uses an 8-part sort key of the these job attributes (strongest is first):
  • PreJobPrio1 (higher is better)
  • PreJobPrio2 (higher is better)
  • JobPrio (higher is better)
  • PostJobPrio1 (higher is better)
  • PostJobPrio2 (higher is better)
  • QDate (lower is better)
  • ClusterId (lower is better)
  • ProcId (lower is better)

The Pre and Post attributes are undefined by default. When comparing two jobs, if a given Pre or Post attribute is undefined in either job ad, then they are considered equal and the next part of the sort key is examined. This can result in sets of jobs where there's no clear ordering.

Consider the following set of jobs:
Job ID PreJobPrio1 JobPrio
12.0 2 1
13.0 Undefined 2
14.0 1 3

Job 12.0 sorts before 14.0 (both have PreJobPrio1 and 12.0's value is larger). Job 13.0 sorts both before 12.0 and after 14.0 (13.0 doesn't have PreJobPrio1 defined, so JobPrio is used for the sort comparison). There's no clear ordering.

The sorting algorithm should be changed so that an undefined attribute is treated as the value 0.
remarks:
CODE_REVIEW: change looks good.

as a side note, we should probably drop one of the PreJob prios and one of the PostJob prios. this is insanely overdesigned....
